block.p: Cristina Clara Vidal, the vice president for operations of Oliver Productions Inc. in Washington, the company that produces ''The McLaughlin Group,'' and John Joseph McLaughlin, the host of the NBC and PBS program, are to be married this afternoon. The Rev. James L. Connor is to perform the ceremony at Holy Trinity Roman Catholic Church in Washington.

The bride, 36, graduated from Hunter College. She is the daughter of Viviana A. Mejia of Yonkers and Rafael L. Cuello of Santo Domingo, Dominican Republic. The bride's father is a freelance television and radio sportscaster in Santo Domingo.

The Rev. James L. Connor is to perform the ceremony at Holy Trinity Roman Catholic Church in Washington.

The bride, 36, graduated from Hunter College. She is the daughter of Viviana A. Mejia of Yonkers and Rafael L. Cuello of Santo Domingo, Dominican Republic. The bride's father is a freelance television and radio sportscaster in Santo Domingo.

Dr. McLaughlin, 70, is also the executive producer and host of ''John McLaughlin's One on One,'' a weekly interview program. He graduated from Boston College, where he also received master's degrees in philosophy and English literature. He received a Ph.D. in philosophy from Columbia University. His previous marriage ended in divorce.
He is a son of the late Eva P. McLaughlin and the late Augustus H. McLaughlin. His father was a salesman, based in Providence, R.I., for Thomasville Furniture in the New England region.
The couple met at a bookstore in New York in 1990.
